Service Details: - Works to provide programs and services to all young people in BC who, for whatever reason, spent time receiving service (including being in care) from the government- A community of young people and allies welcome all young people who’ve experienced care in BC to engage in our work and programs as participants, as volunteers and in leadership positions- Programming includes Education, Leadership, Local Development, One-to-One Support, Partners for Change, Power Pages, Rights 2 Success, Steering Committee Meetings, Transitions, Volunteer and Youth Voices, Community Engagement and Media- Also welcomes community partners and those striving to be allies to youth in and from care to connect with us and see how we can work together
Eligibility: Ages: 14 year(s) - 24 year(s)- Membership Program is open to any young person in and from government care in BC between the ages of 14-24- There are no membership fees and a young person can renew their membership every two years or cancel their membership at anytime
How to Apply: To become a member, please visit our website and fill out a membership form or call our office for additional details
Address & Map: Queens Court625 Agnes St, Unit 500New Westminster, BC     V3M 5Y4View MapQuest Map
Established: Created in 1993 by young people in care
